result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl C Panfil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge. To be paid out of up to 25% prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  
Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving four (4) years Initial Confinement.

**03-26-16/Order granting one additional day of sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by he department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Randi C, Christopher K. and PNC Bank located at 9330 W. Greenfield Ave, West Allis, WI.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.   Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.addlTxt: per remittitur dated July 11, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP000814 CRNM,  IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on FEBRUARY 16, 2017, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated July 11, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP814-CRNM IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

per order dated March 20, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP{814-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that this March 20, 2017 document shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review.  However a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. Rule 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by April 19, 2017.  If the statement is not filed by that time, this court will dispose of this matter based solely on the documents that have been filed.

per order dated February 16, 2017, Appeal No. 16AP814-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Kaitlin A. Lamb is relieved of further representation of Panfil in this matter.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carl C Panfil in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Carl C Panfil in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Randi C.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 10 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 5 years with credit for 45 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Randi C., Christopher K. and PNC Bank located at 9330 W. Greenfield Ave., West Allis, WI
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 4 years initial confinement.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Appeal rights given.    

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
filed.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court appearing by telephone, defendant Carl C Panfil not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin by telephone.  Court in trial, parties have agreed upon to date and called court to schedule.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JUSTICE POINT PRE-TRIAL REPORT, FILED
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Carl C Panfil in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armor warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JUSTICE POINT PRE-TRIAL REPORT, FILED

Defendant Carl C Panfil in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA St. Junior).  Court futher modifies GPS conditions to allow for release on Sundays to attend AA meetings.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
JUSTICE POINT PRE-TRIAL REPORT, FILED

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail arguments heard.  Court grants modification to GPS as follows: 
Court will allow one hour per month for cashing his check at the bank.  Court will revisit the request to attend disability hearing once a firm date is set.  Order to be submitted by defense counsel.  Case set for scheduling conference on 4-9-15, 8:30.

Defendant Carl C Panfil in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ron Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Progarm Report dated 3/23/15.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Christopher K. or the PNC Bank at 9330 W Greenfield Ave.; West Allis

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
